meanings.definition: To catch or seize suddenly or quickly
meanings.sent1: The cat was nabbing the toy mouse with its paws.
meanings.sent2: The police officer was nabbing the thief as he tried to escape.
meanings.sent3: I saw the squirrel nabbing the nut and running away with it!
meanings.sent4: The idea of nabbing a bargain at the store excited her.
meanings.sent5: The spider was nabbing unsuspecting insects in its web.

meanings.definition: To arrest or apprehend, especially for a crime
meanings.sent1: The detective was nabbing the suspect in the murder case.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were nabbing the gang members involved in the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The police officer nabbing the jaywalker made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The undercover agent was nabbing the criminal mastermind in a thrilling operation.
meanings.sent5: The superhero nabbing the villain made the headlines.
